Source Notes: Neutral greeting you can use all day.
Most common way to get someone’s attention in England.

Source: Could you speak a bit slower, please?

Target: Τα Ελληνικά μου δεν είναι πολύ καλά.
Pronunciation (IPA): /ta eliniˈka mu ðen ˈine poˈli kaˈla/
Pronunciation (Simplified): /ta e-li-ni-ˈka mu then ˈi-ne po-ˈli ka-ˈla/

Source: How do you say … in English?
Could we get the bill, please?

Source Notes: “Toilet” is the usual word in the UK; “loo” is very informal.
